verses.verse: Zedekiah <WH6667> was one <WH259> and twenty <WH6242> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he began to reign, <WH4427> and he reigned <WH4427> eleven <WH6259> <WH6240> years <WH8141> in Jerusalem. <WH3389> And his mother's <WH517> name <WH8034> was Hamutal <WH2537> the daughter <WH1323> of Jeremiah <WH3414> of Libnah. <WH4480> <WH3841>
And he did <WH6213> that which was evil <WH7451> in the eyes <WH5869> of the LORD, <WH3068> according to all <WH3605> that <WH834> Jehoiakim <WH3079> had done. <WH6213>

For <WH3588> through <WH5921> the anger <WH639> of the LORD <WH3068> it came to pass <WH1961> in Jerusalem <WH3389> and Judah, <WH3063> till <WH5704> he had cast them out <WH7993> <WH853> from <WH4480> <WH5921> his presence, <WH6440> that Zedekiah <WH6667> rebelled <WH4775> against the king <WH4428> of Babylon. <WH894>

And it came to pass <WH1961> in the ninth <WH8671> year <WH8141> of his reign, <WH4427> in the tenth <WH6224> month, <WH2320> in the tenth <WH6218> day of the month, <WH2320> that Nebuchadnezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> came, <WH935> he <WH1931> and all <WH3605> his army, <WH2428> against <WH5921> Jerusalem, <WH3389> and pitched <WH2583> against <WH5921> it, and built <WH1129> forts <WH1785> against <WH5921> it round about. <WH5439>
So the city <WH5892> was besieged <WH935> <WH4692> unto <WH5704> the eleventh <WH6249> <WH6240> year <WH8141> of king <WH4428> Zedekiah. <WH6667>

And in the fourth <WH7243> month, <WH2320> in the ninth <WH8672> day of the month, <WH2320> the famine <WH7458> was sore <WH2388> in the city, <WH5892> so that there was <WH1961> no <WH3808> bread <WH3899> for the people <WH5971> of the land. <WH776>

Then the city <WH5892> was broken up, <WH1234> and all <WH3605> the men <WH376> of war <WH4421> fled, <WH1272> and went forth <WH3318> out of the city <WH4480> <WH5892> by night <WH3915> by the way <WH1870> of the gate <WH8179> between <WH996> the two walls, <WH2346> which <WH834> was by <WH5921> the king's <WH4428> garden; <WH1588> (now the Chaldeans <WH3778> were by <WH5921> the city <WH5892> round about: ) <WH5439> and they went <WH1980> by the way <WH1870> of the plain. <WH6160>

But the army <WH2428> of the Chaldeans <WH3778> pursued <WH7291> after <WH310> the king, <WH4428> and overtook <WH5381> <WH853> Zedekiah <WH6667> in the plains <WH6160> of Jericho; <WH3405> and all <WH3605> his army <WH2428> was scattered <WH6327> from <WH4480> <WH5921> him.

Then they took <WH8610> <WH853> the king, <WH4428> and carried him up <WH5927> unto <WH413> the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> to Riblah <WH7247> in the land <WH776> of Hamath; <WH2574> where he gave <WH1696> judgment <WH4941> upon <WH854> him.

And the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> slew <WH7819> <WH853> the sons <WH1121> of Zedekiah <WH6667> before his eyes: <WH5869> he slew <WH7819> also <WH1571> <WH853> all <WH3605> the princes <WH8269> of Judah <WH3063> in Riblah. <WH7247>

Then he put out <WH5786> the eyes <WH5869> of Zedekiah; <WH6667> and the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> bound <WH631> him in chains, <WH5178> and carried <WH935> him to Babylon, <WH894> and put <WH5414> him in prison <WH1004> <WH6486> till <WH5704> the day <WH3117> of his death. <WH4194>

Now in the fifth <WH2549> month, <WH2320> in the tenth <WH6218> day of the month, <WH2320> which <WH1931> was the nineteenth <WH8672> <WH6240> year <WH8141> of Nebuchadnezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon, <WH894> came <WH935> Nebuzaradan, <WH5018> captain <WH7227> of the guard, <WH2876> which served <WH5975> <WH6440> the king <WH4428> of Babylon, <WH894> into Jerusalem, <WH3389>

And burned <WH8313> <WH853> the house <WH1004> of the LORD, <WH3068> and the king's <WH4428> house; <WH1004> and all <WH3605> the houses <WH1004> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> and all <WH3605> the houses <WH1004> of the great <WH1419> men, burned <WH8313> he with fire: <WH784>

And all <WH3605> the army <WH2428> of the Chaldeans, <WH3778> that <WH834> were with <WH854> the captain <WH7227> of the guard, <WH2876> broke down <WH5422> all <WH3605> the walls <WH2346> of Jerusalem <WH3389> round about. <WH5439>

Then Nebuzaradan <WH5018> the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> carried away captive <WH1540> certain of the poor <WH4480> <WH1803> of the people, <WH5971> and the residue <WH3499> of the people <WH5971> that remained <WH7604> in the city, <WH5892> and those that fell away, <WH5307> that <WH834> fell <WH5307> to <WH413> the king <WH4428> of Babylon, <WH894> and the rest <WH3499> of the multitude. <WH527>
But Nebuzaradan <WH5018> the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> left <WH7604> certain of the poor <WH4480> <WH1803> of the land <WH776> for vinedressers <WH3755> and for husbandmen. <WH3009>

Also the pillars <WH5982> of brass <WH5178> that <WH834> were in the house <WH1004> of the LORD, <WH3068> and the bases, <WH4350> and the brazen <WH5178> sea <WH3220> that <WH834> was in the house <WH1004> of the LORD, <WH3068> the Chaldeans <WH3778> broke, <WH7665> and carried <WH5375> <WH853> all <WH3605> the brass <WH5178> of them to Babylon. <WH894>

The caldrons <WH5518> also, and the shovels, <WH3257> and the snuffers, <WH4212> and the bowls, <WH4219> and the spoons, <WH3709> and all <WH3605> the vessels <WH3627> of brass <WH5178> wherewith <WH834> they ministered, <WH8334> took they away. <WH3947>

And the basins, <WH5592> and the firepans, <WH4289> and the bowls, <WH4219> and the caldrons, <WH5518> and the candlesticks, <WH4501> and the spoons, <WH3709> and the cups; <WH4518> that which <WH834> was of gold <WH2091> in gold, <WH2091> and that which <WH834> was of silver <WH3701> in silver, <WH3701> took <WH3947> the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> away.

The two <WH8147> pillars, <WH5982> one <WH259> sea, <WH3220> and twelve <WH8147> <WH6240> brazen <WH5178> bulls <WH1241> that <WH834> were under <WH8478> the bases, <WH4350> which <WH834> king <WH4428> Solomon <WH8010> had made <WH6213> in the house <WH1004> of the LORD: <WH3068> the brass <WH5178> of all <WH3605> these <WH428> vessels <WH3627> was <WH1961> without <WH3808> weight. <WH4948>

And concerning the pillars, <WH5982> the height <WH6967> of one <WH259> pillar <WH5982> was eighteen <WH8083> <WH6240> cubits; <WH520> and a fillet <WH2339> of twelve <WH8147> <WH6240> cubits <WH520> did compass <WH5437> it; and the thickness <WH5672> thereof was four <WH702> fingers: <WH676> it was hollow. <WH5014>

And a chapiter <WH3805> of brass <WH5178> was upon <WH5921> it; and the height <WH6967> of one <WH259> chapiter <WH3805> was five <WH2568> cubits, <WH520> with network <WH7639> and pomegranates <WH7416> upon <WH5921> the chapiters <WH3805> round about, <WH5439> all <WH3605> of brass. <WH5178> The second <WH8145> pillar <WH5982> also and the pomegranates <WH7416> were like unto these. <WH428>

And there were <WH1961> ninety <WH8673> and six <WH8337> pomegranates <WH7416> on a side; <WH7307> and all <WH3605> the pomegranates <WH7416> upon <WH5921> the network <WH7639> were a hundred <WH3967> round about. <WH5439>

And the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> took <WH3947> <WH853> Seraiah <WH8304> the chief <WH7218> priest, <WH3548> and Zephaniah <WH6846> the second <WH4932> priest, <WH3548> and the three <WH7969> keepers <WH8104> of the door: <WH5592>

He took <WH3947> also out of <WH4480> the city <WH5892> a <WH259> eunuch, <WH5631> which <WH834> had <WH1961> the charge <WH6496> of <WH5921> the men <WH376> of war; <WH4421> and seven <WH7651> men <WH376> of them that were near <WH4480> <WH7200> the king's <WH4428> person, <WH6440> which <WH834> were found <WH4672> in the city; <WH5892> and the principal <WH8269> scribe <WH5608> of the host, <WH6635> who mustered <WH6633> <WH853> the people <WH5971> of the land; <WH776> and threescore <WH8346> men <WH376> of the people <WH4480> <WH5971> of the land, <WH776> that were found <WH4672> in the midst <WH8432> of the city. <WH5892>
So Nebuzaradan <WH5018> the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> took <WH3947> them, and brought <WH1980> them to <WH413> the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> to Riblah. <WH7247>

And the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> smote <WH5221> them, and put them to death <WH4191> in Riblah <WH7247> in the land <WH776> of Hamath. <WH2574> Thus Judah <WH3063> was carried away captive <WH1540> out of <WH4480> <WH5921> his own land. <WH127>

This <WH2088> is the people <WH5971> whom <WH834> Nebuchadnezzar <WH5019> carried away captive: <WH1540> in the seventh <WH7651> year <WH8141> three <WH7969> thousand <WH505> Jews <WH3064> and three <WH7969> and twenty: <WH6242>

In the eighteenth <WH8083> <WH6240> year <WH8141> of Nebuchadnezzar <WH5019> he carried away captive <WH1540> from Jerusalem <WH4480> <WH3389> eight <WH8083> hundred <WH3967> thirty <WH7970> and two <WH8147> persons: <WH5315>

In the three <WH7969> and twentieth <WH6242> year <WH8141> of Nebuchadnezzar <WH5019> Nebuzaradan <WH5018> the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> carried away captive <WH1540> of the Jews <WH3064> seven <WH7651> hundred <WH3967> forty <WH705> and five <WH2568> persons: <WH5315> all <WH3605> the persons <WH5315> were four <WH702> thousand <WH505> and six <WH8337> hundred. <WH3967>

And it came to pass <WH1961> in the seven <WH7651> and thirtieth <WH7970> year <WH8141> of the captivity <WH1546> of Jehoiachin <WH3078> king <WH4428> of Judah, <WH3063> in the twelfth <WH8147> <WH6240> month, <WH2320> in the five <WH2568> and twentieth <WH6242> day of the month, <WH2320> that Evil-merodach <WH192> king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> in the first year <WH8141> of his reign <WH4438> lifted up <WH5375> <WH853> the head <WH7218> of Jehoiachin <WH3078> king <WH4428> of Judah, <WH3063> and brought him forth <WH3318> <WH853> out of prison, <WH4480> <WH1004> <WH3628>

And spoke <WH1696> kindly <WH2896> unto <WH854> him, and set <WH5414> <WH853> his throne <WH3678> above <WH4480> <WH4605> the throne <WH3678> of the kings <WH4428> that <WH834> were with <WH854> him in Babylon, <WH894>
And changed <WH8138> <WH853> his prison <WH3608> garments: <WH899> and he did continually <WH8548> eat <WH398> bread <WH3899> before <WH6440> him all <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of his life. <WH2416>

And for his diet, <WH737> there was a continual <WH8548> diet <WH737> given <WH5414> him of <WH4480> <WH854> the king <WH4428> of Babylon, <WH894> every day <WH3117> <WH3117> a portion <WH1697> until <WH5704> the day <WH3117> of his death, <WH4194> all <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of his life. <WH2416>
